docs.abstract: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump and their surrogates travel to battleground states to campaign in wake of Republican and Democratic National Conventions, marking beginning of general election proper.

headline.main: With 100 Days to Go, Candidates Take Fight to Battleground States

byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from Indianapolis, and Noah Remnick from Colorado Springs.

docs.snippet: Courts have dealt setbacks in three states to Republican efforts that critics contend restrict voting rights — blocking a North Carolina law requiring photo identification, loosening a similar measure in Wisconsin and halting strict citizens...
